sentences.english: But developers have little incentive to build less-profitable units for low-income households.
sentences.chinese: 但开发商不愿为低收入家庭建造低利润的单元房。

sentences.english: And they preferred hunger and famine to the desecration of the ancestral grave…
sentences.chinese: 他们宁可自己忍饥挨饿也不愿亵渎祖先们的坟茔。

sentences.english: They take a day of sick leave rather than admit to being off because of pet bereavement.
sentences.chinese: 他们宁可请病假而不愿承认因为痛失宠物而请假。

sentences.english: Why don't we just accept it for what it often is--the other person's genuine concern and desire to help?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不愿接受别人的真诚关注和帮助？

sentences.english: Wikileaks.org, which published the documents, won't reveal its source.
sentences.chinese: org作为发布这些文件的网站，不愿透露其来源。

sentences.english: Griffins now sometimes glide rather than always flapping their wings.
sentences.chinese: 新来者现在有时滑动不愿总是拍打他们的翅膀。

sentences.english: I would rather be scolded than cheat (others).
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿挨骂不愿欺骗人。

sentences.english: I'd rather have seen him gnash his teeth than smile so.
sentences.chinese: 我宁可看他咬牙也不愿看这样的笑。

sentences.english: He did not want to think of the mutilated under-side of the fish.
sentences.chinese: 他不愿想象鱼腹下面残缺的样子。

sentences.english: The officer, who refused to give his name, said Fang was on his way to the airport.
sentences.chinese: 该不愿透露姓名的警察表明方滨兴正在赶往机场。

sentences.english: She would rather tell the truth than lie.
sentences.chinese: 她宁愿讲实话而不愿说谎。

sentences.english: He refused to accept the money.
Max didn't even want to think about the Garudan slaves.
sentences.chinese: 麦克斯甚至不愿去想嘎鲁达的奴隶们。

sentences.english: The old worker would not cast off the ragged coat that reminded him of the old days.
sentences.chinese: 老工人不愿丢掉那件使他回忆起过去岁月的破褂子。

sentences.english: Did it just for the fun of it, but was too lazy to stay by the union.
sentences.chinese: 他搞罢工只是为了好玩，可是太懒，不愿留在工会里。

sentences.english: They were also reluctant to respond to international political pressure led by the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 他们还不愿向由美国主导的国际政治压力低头。

definition: preferably/one would prefer to...(or not to...)/would rather/(would) be better to/(to pick) the lesser of two evils
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
inadvertent/accidental/to have no intention of (doing sth)
would rather.../it would be better.../would prefer
willingness/would rather (agree to X than Y)
need not/does not have to/not necessarily
